questions.question_text: Clearance limit is defined as:
options: the flight level to which an aircraft is granted ATC clearance
the time at which the ATC clearance expires
the point to which aircraft is granted ATC clearance
the height below which you will hit the first obstacle

questions.question_text: The instruction from ATC to an aircraft to abandon its take-off includes the phrase:
The term "DISREGARD" means:
options: pay no attention to what I say

questions.question_text: The message "CHECK" to an aircraft means that you should:
options: confirm that you received and understood the last message
pass the required information to ATC

questions.question_text: The call sign suffix of a station providing clearance delivery would be:
The term "CORRECTION" is used when:
options: the readback of a message is incorrect
the readback of a message is correct
the message has to be deleted
an error has been made in the transmission and the correct version is ...

questions.question_text: The state of urgency is defined as a condition:
options: of being threatened by serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance
concerning the safety of an aircraft or other vehicle or of some person on board, but does not require immediate assistance
where an aircraft requires an immediate take-off
where the aircraft needs to land immediately because the crew are running out of duty time

questions.question_text: The response to a general call from ATC is for the aircraft to:
options: request a repeat of the message

questions.question_text: If a transponder is unserviceable before an IFR departure, then the pilot:
options: may proceed with the flight with ATC permission
has to fly low level only

questions.question_text: Following a communications failure, the time at which the aircraft should aim to leave the hold is:
options: within 10 minutes of the EAT or ETA
within 30 minutes of the EAT or ETA
before it runs out of fuel

questions.question_text: The call "PAN PAN MEDICAL" indicates that:
options: the flight is concerning a protected medical transport pursuant to the 1949 Geneva Convention
there is concern about the safety of the aircraft or other vehicle or a person on board, but does not require immediate assistance
one of the flight crew has been taken ill
the crew require medical aid on the pan

questions.question_text: An urgency message should include the following information:
options: name of station addressed, aircraft call sign, nature of urgency condition, intention of commander, position, level, heading
call sign, position, route, destination, endurance
name of station addressed, call sign, present position, level, ETA destination

questions.question_text: Readability 2 means that your transmission is:
How does ATC report RVR?
options: In kilometres along the final approach
In metres at touchdown, midpoint and stop end of runway
In nautical miles along the runway

questions.question_text: An aircraft departing on an IFR flight under radar vectors has a communication failure. What action should be taken in addition to squawking 7600?
options: Maintain the heading last assigned by ATC for 3 minutes, then return to the flight path according to the flight plan
Return to the current flight plan route in the most direct manner
Maintain present heading for 1 minute then return to the flight plan route
Return by the shortest way to the flight plan route, regardless of any limitation issued by ATC

questions.question_text: An altitude of 13 500 ft would be spoken as:
options: ONE THREE THOUSAND FIVE ZERO ZERO FEET
ONE THREE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED FEET

questions.question_text: What cannot be left out from a position report?
options: Call sign, Flight level and Time
Position, Time, Flight level, Next position and ETA

questions.question_text: The call sign suffix for an airfield without radar would be:
The definition of the instruction "MONITOR ..." is:
options: watch out for visual signals on frequency

questions.question_text: The phrase "BRAKING COEFFICIENT 20" from ATC means that the braking action is:
Your reply to the message "REPORT FLIGHT CONDITIONS" should be:
A waypoint is:
options: a geographical point at which a change of level takes place
a geographical location relating to area navigation (RNAV)
a visual sign pointing the way

questions.question_text: If you are repeating a word or a message for clarity then you should use the phrase:
The condition that describes the state of an aircraft in serious and/or imminent danger and requiring immediate assistance is:
If you make a mistake in transmission you should use the phrase:
An example of a general call is:
options: STOP IMMEDIATELY I SAY AGAIN STOP IMMEDIATELY

questions.question_text: The frequency 121.5 MHz is the:
options: one way air to ground emergency frequency

questions.question_text: The ATC message "DISTRESS TRAFFIC ENDED" signifies that:
options: normal ATC is resumed after an emergency
all aircraft are to end their transmissions
all aircraft on the frequency are to change to another frequency

questions.question_text: The phrase used to separate portions of a message is:
The term "RECLEARED" means that:
options: your last clearance has been cancelled
you may proceed as you please
a change has been made to your last clearance and this new clearance supersedes your previous clearance
